ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the foundations of Spanish and feel I can understand basic communication in Spanish.
I learned a lot of spanish!

I learned a lot of vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure from this course. I learned the basics of Spanish, including the core vocabulary, past and present tenses, reflexive verbs, indirect object pronouns, and direct object pronouns.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was terribly run. The top down approach completely discouraged engagementnot only were the assignments tedious and sometimes disrespectful but they oftentimes contained grammatical errors and mistakes in writing. Most of class time was completely unnecessary because the department feels that most of the learning should happen outside of it. However, what is then the point of having in-person sessions when most of our learning can supposedly be substituted by an electronic dude speaking to us from the computer? This class seriously discounts the benefits of in-person learning and does the opposite of facilitating classroom engagement.

Strengths: lots of help from professor, lots of speaking
weaknesses: heavy homework load

Strengths are that because its a set curriculum, its pretty organized. Weakness is that for that same reason, the professor has very little authority in adjusting things for the class, and also the set curriculum is sometimes not the best and it can feel like you're learning more from the online VHL than in class.

I enjoyed the Linguameetings, which helped me practice what I learned in class. I thought the VHL was extremely helpful in introducing the concepts the day before we learned them, and the practice problems on VHL were useful. The only thing I think can be improved is more conversation in Spanish during class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Do not take this class unless you are passionate about learning Spanish. It is very poorly organized and you will suffer because the workload is intense but tedious.
Yes, provides a great base for learning how to speak spanish.
Yes! If you want to learn Spanish, I think that its a great way to get started

I would recommend this course to another student because it is a great way to attain a strong foundation of the Spanish language and you will leave the class with a great comprehension of the framework for Spanish.
